intro: Saussurea lampsanifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Saussurea lampsanifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Tibetan medicine.
